meanings.definition: Giving off or reflecting a lot of light; shining.
meanings.sent1: The sun is brighter than the moon in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The flashlight became brighter as the batteries were changed.
meanings.sent3: The disco ball was so bright that it made everyone want to dance.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a brighter beacon in the dark room of sadness.
meanings.sent5: The stars in the night sky seemed even brighter after the power outage.

meanings.definition: More intelligent or quick-witted than average.
meanings.sent1: The brighter students quickly grasped the concept.
meanings.sent2: She had a brighter idea for solving the puzzle.
meanings.sent3: The detective's brighter mind helped solve the mystery in no time.
meanings.sent4: His brighter intellect shone through during the challenging exam.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's brighter approach led to a groundbreaking discovery.

meanings.sent1: Her brighter outlook on life inspired those around her.
meanings.sent2: The brighter attitude of the team lifted everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent3: Even on a rainy day, his brighter demeanor brought sunshine.
meanings.sent4: The brighter mood in the room made the party even more enjoyable.
meanings.sent5: Their brighter laughter echoed through the halls, spreading joy.
